article.headline: Pence-Harris debate still on track for next week despite Trump's coronavirus diagnosis: report
article.body: The debate between Sen. Kamala Harris and Vice President Mike Pence planned for Oct. 7 will go on as scheduled, according to a report from the Associated Press, citing officials with the debate commission. The event, which was planned to be held in Salt Lake City, Utah, was in question after President Donald Trump early Friday announced that he and first lady Melania tested positive for COVID-19. Both Pence and Harris underwent tests for the coronavirus on Friday and tested negative, the AP reported. News of Trump's coronavirus diagnosis roiled markets on Friday, but stock benchmarks, the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, +0.56%, the S&P 500 index SPX, +0.87% and the Nasdaq Composite Index COMP, +1.39%, were off their worst levels in afternoon trade.
